values:
Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

In February I ruled Iran as a kind and benevolent dictator (700 points). Last month I helped see the light (8 points). Last Tuesday I pulled 's hair (-5 points). In January I punched in the arm (-10 points). Last Saturday I ate my brussel sprouts (1 points).

Overall, I've been nice (694 points). For Christmas I deserve a shiny red ball!

Sincerely,
vibrato83

Write your letter to Santa! Enter your LJ username:
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/4438.html

Hey y'all!  I'm back here at Rice, done with my second day of classes.  It's hot as all get out down here.  I'm fixin' to take a shower right quick.

I sure do miss my old roomate who used to update my livejournal for me.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/4179.html

Stephanie's Survey


Three names you go by:

1. Catherine
2. CB 
3. Kate
wait!! I want a #4
4. Cat

Three screen names you've had:

I'll make up for adding an extra number in the previous question... I've only ever had one screen name:
1. vibrato8

Three physical things you like about yourself:

1. Eyes - Have you seen Facebook?  Brown eyes are [so] sexy.
2. My hands and lips - because with them I play my flute
3. My face - I like it prit' well.

Three physical things you hate about yourself:

1. My feet - thank goodness for shoes to hide them ;). 
2. My hips - Or, I suppose, my serious lack of any.
3. My tummy - sometimes it's okay, but most of the time it frustrates me!

Three parts of your heritage:

German
Irish
Polish
(etc, etc....)

Three things that scare you:

Not having my music
Having a baby
Flute choirs (even I can't take that much flute all at once)

Three of your everyday essentials:

My flute
Enough sleep and a shower
Music (good speakers)

PS: My music just changed to Piazzolla Tango ;)

Three things you are wearing right now:

(While I was practicing today, the Fed Ex lady knocked on the door and I was so embarassed to be in this outfit, lol)
Some really comfy, and sadly, on the edge of retirement, grey lounging pants
An old black polo shirt
Ankle socks

Three musical artists or bands:
Cleveland Orchestra
Dvorak (8)
Julius Baker
(I could handle some bagpipe music right now, too)

Three favorite songs (...) PIECES:
Dvorak 8 with Cleveland Orchestra and Dohnanyi
Turandot with the Met Opera and Pavarotti
Appalachian Spring 13-player version (at Shepherd... mmm)

Three things I want in a relationship:
Someone open, easy and fun to talk to
Passion (for life! ;)
Understanding

Two truths (T) and one lie (F):
I miss Rice, Shepherd, and my Swampies
I am about to have dinner with my family
I hate reading these things 

Three physical things about the opposite sex that appeal to you:

A good, wide, and sincere smile
Interesting eyes
A hearty laugh

Three favorite hobbies:

Flute isn't a "hobby..." so -
Reading
Talking 
Laughing

Three things you want to do badly right now:

Be at Shepherd in orchestra or in practice room 2259 when the heat isn't on too high
Have a good laugh with my Swamp girls
Find a good, page-turner novel and read it straight through

Three careers you are considering:

Orchestral Musician
Soloist
Flute teacher

Three places you want to go on a vacation:

Paris
The Grand Canyon
Japan

Three kids names you really like:

Sam
Azalea
Willa

Three things you want to do before you die:

Have a great orchestral and solo career
Find love
Travel
 
Three people you want to take this survey:

Sirrah
Adam
Nat
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/3935.html
Pink Floyd is my favourite band.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/3832.html

I decided not to major in flute performance.  I'm just not that into flute anymore.  I guess I "burned out" already.  My parents don't know yet, and I'm still trying to think of how I'm going to break it to them.  But it's too late to change my mind, because I already sold my flute to a pawn shop for beer money.

I've decided instead that I'm going to double major in linguistics and mechanical engineering.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/3405.html

So I'm trying to do my philosophy homework, and my idiot roomate is over there playing Scottish techno music so loud the walls are shaking.  Her side of the room is a mess, too, and frankly, I'm sick of looking at the Latin verb conjugations she has taped up all over the wall.

Just kidding!

I have a bad cough, and my throat is really sore.  I borrowed some ibuprofen from Gracie this afternoon, so it must be because my throat is sore.  I mean, of course I would know if my own throat was sore, it's not like this isn't me, Catherine, typing this.  Because it is me, Catherine, typing this.  I update my own livejournal.  It's not like I would let someone else do it for me or anything.

Goodnight!
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/3195.html

That was Ace again.  Don't trust this journal ;)  But I am happy for the weekend - going out with friends tonight.  

I love Rice so much.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/2880.html

Happy quasi-Friday everyone!  Classes are over for the week.  We can't think of anything to do right now, so I think we're about to go get some movies and have a movie-watching party.

Have a good weekend!
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/2803.html
I'm nervous.  It's April Fool's Day, and my roommate is the infamous Ace... Something's going to happen to me.  Sarah knows what it is, too.  She won't even give me a hint.  Help. Please.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/2401.html

This was probably her plan anyway, to get me to update this thing, but the previous post was written by my roommate.  lol.  She decided to take it upon herself to chronicle the life of her apathetic (rith respect to LJ) roommate... This is perfectly okay with me, but I just had to set things straight so that I would not decieve all my "loyal fans."  

My roommies have convinced me to ingest large amounts of caffeine and stay up all night long.  Not sure how that's going to go... But it's Willy Week -- I ought to be a little crazy ;)

It's Friday tomorrow!!  

And FYI, Leslie's flute recital is Saturday @ 4 after most of the Beer Bike stuff will be done!  It's going to be great.  So scoot on over to Duncan (or take the 'shittle') and hear it!

CB
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/2201.html

I apologize to all my loyal fans for not posting in so long, but my roomate (who is totally awesome) talked some sense into me, so I'm going to start posting again. I had my aural skills exam today, and I think I aced it! I was a little nervous, but it went well. I rewarded myself afterwards with a long nap, and I just woke up. I'm going to go to Shepherd and practice for a while now. It's almost the weekend!
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/1846.html

Tampon Man is my friend.

Who else but me....  *laughing*
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/1661.html

This day has gotten much, much better!  I talked to all of my family today when they called... everyone passed around the phone, and it made me feel like I was there :)  And I spent a while chatting with my grandma today.  She is so great!  I just found out that she's going to drive from Michigan to our house to visit while I'm home - yay!!

I'm off to Ms. Buyse's for dinner, soon...  I think my ride is here, so I'll update more later.  Hope everybody has a wonderful Turkey Day!
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/1417.html

A little bummed out...  I miss home.  Thanksgiving is one of our favorite holidays back home - it's always at our house, and always a big deal and lots of fun.  It'll be okay -- only 9 more days to go.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/1044.html

What a beautiful storm!  The whole sky is lighting up, and the wind is blowing so hard that all the trash cans and recycling bins tipped over.  There are some Wiessmen outside on the second floor enoying the cool (yes, cool!) wind and rain...  Looks like fun if only I weren't in my pajamas and busy working on theory. 
Speaking of, it's time for me to get back to work.
The girls are leaving tomorrow...  It'll be a bit lonely around here!  But Jessica will be around, so tomorrow we're biking to Whole Foods to do some shopping for food over the weekend (the serveries will be closed.)  And there'll be lots of time to practice, read, study, work on these final papers and projects!  Only 10 more days till my return to good ol' K-town!  I have a feeling I'll miss this place while I'm home, as wonderful as home will be!
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/982.html

Here begins my second post of the day...  Just waiting a few minutes more before going to work on my papers and things!  It's beautiful outside; the windows are open, it's dark, and lighting flashes every few minutes.  We have a great view from our room.  

In my last post I didn't mention what an awesome weekend I had.  Except for being scared out of my mind after watching "The Exorcist" for the first time (If you haven't seen it, don't.  Ever.)  Granted, it was better than some of the mindless, violent horror movies out there, but it was terrifying.  After that movie ended (I was so relieved when the credits came on at the end...) we played some cheery music and Gracie taught Sarah and I to play Egyptian Rat Screw.  That game is so much fun!!  Then on Saturday Sarah and I went downtown to the science museum, where we went into an incredible butterfly exhibit, saw lots of other interesting things, and did a little shopping in the museum store (where from Beorn came...see previous post!)  

After Sarah and I finished looking around the museum, we decided it was time for some dinner.  Bad idea, especially when it's late and dark and we're wandering in the 4th largest city in the US.  Nothing happened really, other than we were a bit nervous, and after checking out a few restaurants, saw that getting drunk in a bar late at night while lots of loud and anxious music is playing isn't really our cup of tea.  But we made it back on the Metro just fine, and just as soon as we reached those familiar Rice hedges, my scooter died.  (Too much wandering in the museum wore poor Scootie out.)  Fortunately, I had my charger with me, and plugged it in at the Rice police station.  Then Sarah and I got an secort back to our room, put our bags down, and ventured (me on my bike this time) to the Village, where we had a great dinner in a cute french cafe.  We stopped at Walgreens and picked up some things, then Sarah rode my freshly charged scooter back to the Swamp while I biked.  It was funny to watch her ride it :)

And that night, Sarah, Gracie and I began we're sure will be one of the great Swamp traditions: Celtic Card Night!  We played cards, drank hot chocolate, turned on some awesome Scottish music, and laughed really hard.  

By that time, the wee hours of Sunday morning had arrived, nevertheless we turned on Lord of the Dance.... Wait.  Uhh... No we didn't.  Of course we didn't.  Who would watch such a ridiculous thing, eh guys?!  ;) 

Then on Sunday Gracie and I took a trip to the library and explored.  Fondren is amazing!!  And then after some fluting, reading, fooding, and homeworking, I fell asleep until this morning.  It was a great weekend. 

Well, I suppose it's time to get down to work! (Hope work isn't too dreadful tonight, Gracie!!) 

Happy Monday, everyone.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/525.html

Hello out there!

So I've finally started one of these things.  I hope I don't waste too much time...

Right now I'm sitting here trying not to laugh too hard at Gracie; she's at her computer with headphones on pronouncing a bunch of old English words along with a recording.  Sounds like fun.  

We just had a good laugh over the fact that she had to take her wrinkled work clothes out of the dirty laundry - I guess she hasn't washed them in 4 weeks or so, and she has to wear them at work tonight.  Ummm....

Only 11 more days till my flight home!  I really can't wait; it'll be the first time I'll have seen my house and my family since mid August.  In the meantime, though, I'm (honestly!) having some fun working on some projects and papers and getting lots of good practicing done.  It feels great to have time in the afternoons to sit in the room and read and do homework.  The last few weeks were crazy busy.  Lots of fun, but a bit exhausting.  

My roommate and I have a new pet: a Grow Dino from the science museum named Beorn (aka "Warrior" in Old English.)  He's grown just over an inch since we put in in water at 12:46 this morning.  Looks a little gooey and bloated, but we've concluded that it just must be Beorn going through the ugly phase everyone has during adolescence.  ;) 

Time to get back to homework before orchestra tonight - I rearranged my desk last night, and now I have room to put my books somewhere other than on top of the keyboard while I'm reading them.  Very nice.
http://vibrato83.livejournal.com/334.html
